strings: <se_low>King Trode: I don't believe it!
<se_low>King Trode: I say, <leader>! This is no time to be standing around making small talk! Look! There's the ship!
<se_low>King Trode: I never imagined such a place existed just to the south of my own castle!
<se_low>King Trode: Hmm... We should return to the castle. We might be able to find out some information about the ship.

<se_low>King Trode: My poor castle...
I suppose we must return, even though everything's so terribly different now.

<se_high>Jessica: Is that really a ship?
I never saw a ship that looked like that back at Port Prospect.
<se_high>Jessica: And what would it be doing all the way out here so far from the ocean anyway? Can it really be a ship!?

<se_high>Jessica: I just don't get it!
Who in their right mind would lug a ship all the way here!?
<se_high>Jessica: Ouch!
<se_high>Jessica: Now I've got a headache!

<se_low>Yangus: Heh heh! Told ya!
Brains ain't never wrong!
<se_low>Yangus: The odd nudge 'ere and there should 'ave that down to the sea in no time!
<se_low>Yangus: So the old codger's castle ain't far from 'ere? I s'pose 'e must be a king after all then!
<se_low>King Trode: You...!

<se_low>Yangus: Er, anyway, we should do as 'e says this time.
Trodain Castle it is!

<se_def>Angelo: Maybe it's a mirage?
But it doesn't go away no matter how many times I blink.
<se_def>Angelo: Then it must be a dream. What other explanation could there be? Why would such a ridiculously huge ship be stuck all the way out here!?

<se_def>Angelo: Do you really think we can budge it?
I have to say, I've got serious doubts about this.

<se_def>Angelo: Still, each to his own.
If you really want to give it a try, who am I to stop you?
<se_def>Angelo: Let's head over to the troll king's castle and see what we can find out.
<se_high>Jessica: Do you think there's really a way of getting this ship into the sea?
<se_high>Jessica: I guess our only option right now is trying the old books in Trodain Castle library to see if they can give us some kind of clue.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's go and see what we can find.
<se_low>Yangus: The old codger seems to think we might be able to get some clues about the boat at the library in Trodain castle.
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't really one for books, but if it'll 'elp us get this movin' we should give it a go. Come on, guv!
<se_def>Angelo: Trodain goes back a long way. We might be able to find some ancient records about this ship if we look around in the castle library.

<se_def>Angelo: The castle's just north of here.
We may as well go and see if we can get any leads.

<se_low>King Trode: We're getting closer. All you have to do now is find the Moonshadow harp, <hero>.
Then we'll be able to set the ship sailing again.
<se_high>Princess Medea: Neigh!

<se_low>King Trode: We'll easily catch up with Dhoulmagus once we have a ship at our disposal!
The days of this curse are numbered!
<se_high>Princess Medea: (Whinny!) Neigh!
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe there used to be ocean here.
<se_high>Jessica: But I suppose we don't have any choice but to believe it. Let's just hurry up and find the Moonshadow harp. Then we'll see once and for all.

<se_low>Yangus: Brains is a diamond, eh?
Fancy knowin' we'd be able to find a ship all the way out 'ere!
<se_low>Yangus: I s'pose that means he prob'ly knows about the Moonshadow 'arp an' all.
<se_def>Angelo: I don't really see the point in coming back to check up on the ship. I mean, it's so huge that it's hardly likely to be stolen!
<se_def>Angelo: If you're that worried, maybe you should scratch your name on it!?
<se_high>Jessica: Aren't we supposed to go through the tunnel in Ascantha Castle and find the thieves who stole the Moonshadow harp?
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!

<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles!
This is crazy!
<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us. Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.

<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us.
Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_high>Jessica: We've got the harp! Now all we have to do is take it back to Ishmahri and he can use it to get the ship moving again.
<se_high>Jessica: Come on, let's hurry back to Trodain Castle! We've got to get back into that weird moon world!

<se_low>Yangus: I've been thinkin'.
We ain't never really been on a long boat journey together before, eh, guv?
<se_low>Yangus: Shame we can't rustle up a few deckchairs an' enjoy it a bit more, but I s'pose chasin' Dhoulmagus comes first.

<se_low>Yangus: Come on then, guv.
Let's go an' give the 'arp back to that Itchy-Marie bloke.

<se_def>Angelo: What was it that he said, that Ishmahri character?
Something about awakening the sea's memories?
<se_def>Angelo: It's rather a strange concept to get your head round... Still, no need for us to bother with the details.
<se_def>Angelo: Let's just head back to Trodain Castle and go through the Moonshadow window in the library.

<se_high>Jessica: There's nothing.
No ship, no sea...
It's as if they never existed.

<se_high>Jessica: That guy...Ishmahri.
Where do you think he came from?

<se_low>Yangus: We didn't really need that 'arp, y'know.
I could've pushed the boat all the way to the sea no probs.

<se_low>Yangus: Still, wot's done's done.
At least we've got it goin' again now.
<se_def>Angelo: There must have been a fairly large city here in the old days for them to have built such a huge ship.

<se_def>Angelo: And yet now there's nothing left.
It's such a pity...
Wait! Did I just say that?
